Text.Value: Leave.
What do you mean 'this isn't over'?
Take whatever time you need - the hag's not coming back.
Home, to Baldur's Gate. This isn't over yet.

EditorData.NodeContext: Home - pause - to Baldur's Gate. Then strong resolve and grit on 'this isn't over yet'.

Text.Value: There's more hags out there - and I'm going to do what I can to make sure no one else has to go through what I did.
I know.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a nod and exhalation, relief

Text.Value: How did you end up here?
You served her - give me one good reason to let you live.
Where will you go?
As soon as my head's clear, I'm heading back to Baldur's Gate to finish this.

EditorData.NodeContext: still slightly shaky, but with resolve

Text.Value: Pull yourself together - the hag's dead. I made sure of it.
It was the mask. It dug its roots into me... took away my will. I tried to fight it.
You're right. I don't feel her anymore... she's really gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: still confused, but regaining her resolve

Text.Value: You're lucky I didn't cut you down.
Heard about this wise woman out in the back-end of nowhere who could help. I knew it was too good to be true. But I didn't care.
I think the danger's passed, but my head's still spinning. I'll leave when I'm steadier on my feet.
But she's been luring victims here for years - plenty of other folk will be grateful too. I'll make sure they know your name.
We need to leave. You're not supposed to be here - she'll be furious.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stupor
EditorData.logicalname: Hag is dead but wasn't summoned

Text.Value: We need to leave - she might not be dead. I don't even know if she can die.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stupor

Text.Value: I'm feeling stronger by the minute. I'll be fine.

EditorData.NodeContext: still slightly shaken, but with resolve

Text.Value: You think Ethel was the only hag in the realms? Not by a long shot.

EditorData.NodeContext: grit and resolve on first phrase. Determination.

Text.Value: I'd have begged Myrkul himself if I thought he'd listen.

EditorData.NodeContext: regret, MER-kul is the god of the dead - turning to him would be a desperate act

Text.Value: Leave.
Where will you go now that you're free?
How do you feel now?
Sheer desperation. My mother's mind is gone... she's forgotten herself. I tried medicine, magic, prayer.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'sheer desperation' is her response to how she ended up dealing with a hag. regret as she tells the story

Text.Value: That warrants a reward, wouldn't you say?
She's dead. You're safe now.
Leave.
The hag took everything except my life. Gratitude's all I can offer for now.

EditorData.NodeContext: apologetically, we just asked for a reward and she has none to give

Text.Value: I thought I was lost... could feel my mind slipping away.

EditorData.NodeContext: still confused, but regaining her resolve

Text.Value: If it weren't for you, I would have ended up like the others. Hollowed out and as good as dead.
Auntie only wants what's best for us.
Attack.
Better... less confused.

EditorData.NodeContext: like somebody responding to a medic after regaining consciousness

Synopsis: A victim of the hag, forced to wear a mask that takes away her free will so that she fights for and serves the hag. If the hag is killed, this character regains her senses and resolve. She's deeply shaken by her experience, but courageous, telling the player that she'll inform the people of Baldur's Gate of our heroism, and vowing to hunt down the hag's accomplices in the city.
